intro: Crassothonna rechingeri, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces a bulbous stem and has strap-like, evergreen leaves that remain throughout the year. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and ability to naturalize in suitable climates.
